intro: Agoseris plebeia, commonly known as the common agoseris, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a hairy texture, while its flowers are yellow with a central disk. Agoseris plebeia is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to thrive in disturbed soils.
